summary: This document is a chain of emails between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York (SDNY), an FBI Special Agent, and a private attorney regarding compliance with a subpoena related to the purchase of a property by 'Granite Reality LLC' for Jeffrey Epstein. The attorney provides documents and notes contact with individuals named 'Jen and Steve Marshal' and their Boston attorney.

persons.name: Jen Marshal
persons.context: Mentioned by the private attorney as a point of contact, along with Steve Marshal, for the entity that purchased a property, with all contact going through them and their Boston attorney.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Mentioned by the private attorney as a point of contact, along with Jen Marshal, for the entity that purchased a property, with all contact going through them and their Boston attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena returns folder is explicitly for Epstein, and the property transaction being discussed is related to him.

connections.description: Both are listed as contacts for the entity ('Granite Reality LLC') that purchased a property related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena Issued and Corrected
events.description: An AUSA from SDNY sends a subpoena related to a property purchase for Jeffrey Epstein. The recipient attorney notes a clerical error in the entity name ('Granite Realty' vs. 'Granite Reality'), and a corrected subpoena is issued.

events.title: Partial Document Production
events.description: The private attorney begins sending responsive documents to the SDNY AUSA and FBI, including a wire confirmation and notes about due diligence on a property purchased for privacy and security.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) issued a subpoena in July 2020 for documents related to a real estate transaction involving an entity named 'Granite Reality LLC' connected to Jeffrey Epstein.
A private attorney, admitted in NH and MA, handled title, settlement, and additional 'privacy and security' due diligence for the property closing.
All contact for the transaction was with 'Jen and Steve Marshal' and their attorney at the Boston law firm Nutter McLennen & Fish.
The email chain shows coordination between an Assistant U.S. Attorney, an FBI Special Agent, and a contractor to collect and store subpoenaed materials.
The document reveals ongoing investigative activity into Epstein's financial and property dealings well after his death in 2019.
